sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine — For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Eric Bailey)
articles.description: WCAG provides guidance for making interactive elements more accessible by specifying minimum size requirements. In this article, Eric Bailey discusses the nuances of interactive element sizes and clarifies what it looks like to provide accessible interactive experiences using WCAG-compliant target sizes.
articles.title: Getting To The Bottom Of Minimum WCAG-Conformant Interactive Element Size

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Mikołaj Dobrucki)
articles.description: In today’s turbulent landscape of design, Penpot stands out with its commitment to open-source, free unlimited access, and its unique, robust features. An example could be its new components system that takes another leap forward in aligning design with code. Let's dive into how it empowers both designers and developers to create more maintainable and scalable design systems.
articles.title: Build Design Systems With Penpot Components

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Yinjian Huang)
articles.description: This in-depth guide takes you through the three crucial phases of conversational search, revealing how users express their needs, explore results, and refine their queries. Learn how AI agents can overcome communication barriers, personalize the search experience, and adapt to evolving user intent.
articles.title: How To Design Effective Conversational AI Experiences: A Comprehensive Guide

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Anna Rátkai)
articles.description: Today, UX design contributes to the problem of excessive consumption through persuasive e-commerce practices and designing for companies with linear and exploitative business models. Anna Rátkai explores practical steps we can take to reduce material consumption and the massive environmental impact that comes along with it by designing mindful shopping experiences.
articles.title: When Friction Is A Good Thing: Designing Sustainable E-Commerce Experiences

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: Visualize the user experience with user journey maps. Here are some helpful templates, real-world applications, and insights on the importance of mapping both successful and unsuccessful touchpoints. Part of [Smart Interface Design Patterns](https://smart-interface-design-patterns.com) by yours truly.
articles.title: Useful Customer Journey Maps (+ Figma & Miro Templates)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Let’s welcome the new month with some fresh desktop wallpapers! Created by artists and designers from across the globe, they come in versions with and without a calendar for July 2024. Enjoy!
articles.title: Tales Of An Eternal Summer (July 2024 Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Irina Silyanova)
articles.description: Interface copy plays a crucial role in the overall user experience, helping guide users smoothly, allowing them to navigate easily through the app, discover and start using product features, and more. In this article, you’ll find simple, practical tips and a checklist to help you create a clear and concise microcopy, ensuring a seamless user experience.
articles.title: How To Improve Your Microcopy: UX Writing Tips For Non-UX Writers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: Gaining buy-in for accessibility can be challenging due to common myths and misunderstandings. For many, accessibility remains a big mystery. Here are some practical techniques for winning stakeholder support. Part of [Smart Interface Design Patterns](https://smart-interface-design-patterns.com) by yours truly.
articles.title: How To Make A Strong Case For Accessibility

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Paul Boag)
articles.description: The biggest mistake you can make in UX design is to launch a website or app and then walk away. Monitoring and improving after launch will benefit users and your metrics. Nothing will bring bigger gains.
articles.title: So Your Website Or App Is Live… Now What?

articles.author: Tiago Monteiro
articles.description: Machine learning (ML) is one of the most important subareas of AI used in building great AI systems. In ML, deep learning is a narrow area focused solely on neural networks. Through the field of deep learning, systems like ChatGPT and many other AI models can be created. In other
articles.title: How to Build a Quantum Artificial Intelligence Model – With Python Code Examples

articles.author: Ashutosh Krishna
articles.description: Sorting is a fundamental operation in programming, essential for organizing data in a specific order. In Java, built-in sorting methods provide efficient ways to sort primitive data types and arrays, making it easy to manage and manipulate collections of data. For instance, you can quickly sort an array of integers
articles.title: Comparable vs Comparator Interfaces in Java – Which Should You Use and When?

articles.author: Eesa Zahed
articles.description: Welcome to this fun and hands-on project where we'll build a calculator that converts Bitcoin to USD. You'll learn about API fetching, DOM manipulation, and localStorage, and you'll use some basic math along the way.  By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a functioning Bitcoin price calculator that
articles.title: How to Build a Simple Bitcoin-to-USD Calculator

articles.author: Danny Adams
articles.description: In React, data is typically passed down from parent to child via props. But this can lead to "prop drilling" – where we have to pass props down through lots of components to get them where they're needed. Also, some props (for example, the current authenticated user, UI theme, or
articles.title: How to Use React's Context API – Tutorial with Examples

articles.author: Daniel Asaboro
articles.description: Enums are one of the most efficient ways to represent a fixed set of values. For example: days of the week, user online status, traffic light states, role hierarchy in an organization, and so on. What's interesting is that most typed languages such as Typescript, Java, C#, and Dart give
articles.title: How to Use Enhanced Enums in Dart – Explained With Code Examples

articles.author: Ashutosh Krishna
articles.description: Instant search is a feature that shows search results as users type their query. Instead of waiting for a full page reload or submitting a form, results appear instantly, allowing users to find what they are looking for quickly. For example, when you start typing in a search box, suggestions
articles.title: How To Implement Instant Search with Flask and HTMX

articles.author: Tomer Ben Rachel
articles.description: When I first built an application [https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.tomerpacific.birthday_calendar&hl=en] using Flutter, I quickly ran into situations where I needed to pass state from widget to widget. These widgets weren’t directly related and all I knew back then was that there were only Stateless widgets or Stateful ones. I found it hard to
articles.title: How to Migrate a Flutter Application from GetIt to Bloc

articles.author: TAPAS ADHIKARY
articles.description: People don't like using slow applications. And the initial load time matters a lot for web applications and websites.  An application that takes more than 3 seconds to load is considered slow and may cause users to leave the application or website. Next.js is a React-based framework you can
articles.title: How to Optimize Next.js App Performance With Lazy Loading

articles.author: Quincy Larson
articles.description: On this week's episode of the podcast, I interview Daniel Bourke. He's a Machine Learning Engineer and creator of many popular tutorials on YouTube. He's also a frequent freeCodeCamp contributor. We talk about: How as a kid he hacked into his school...
articles.title: How to get Machine Learning Skills without doing a PhD in Math [Podcast #133 with Daniel Bourke]

articles.author: Rahul Gupta
articles.description: If you're learning JavaScript, you may have heard the terms reactivity or signals. But perhaps you haven't gotten to use them in practice yet. If so – or if you just want to learn more about these concepts – you're in the right place.  In this article, you'll learn
articles.title: Learn JavaScript Reactivity: How to Build Signals from Scratch
